SEARCH
Package com.dimon.utils

Interface Constants

public interface Constants
This interface defines the key constants used throughout the application. These constants include configurations for fragment size, timeouts, keep-alive intervals, and other protocol-related thresholds.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    HEARTBEAT_FAILURE_THRESHOLD
    The maximum number of consecutive keep-alive message failures before the connection is considered lost and terminated.
    static final int
    KEEP_ALIVE_INTERVAL
    The interval (in milliseconds) between keep-alive messages sent to the peer to ensure the connection remains active.
    static final int
    MAX_SIZE_FRAGMENT
    The maximum size (in bytes) of a data fragment that can be sent in a single UDP packet.
    static final int
    TIMEOUT_THRESHOLD
    The threshold (in milliseconds) after which a connection is considered timed out if no activity or acknowledgment is received from the peer.

  • Field Details

    • MAX_SIZE_FRAGMENT

      static final int MAX_SIZE_FRAGMENT
      The maximum size (in bytes) of a data fragment that can be sent in a single UDP packet. This value is set to ensure compatibility with the typical MTU (Maximum Transmission Unit) for network packets, while leaving space for headers.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • KEEP_ALIVE_INTERVAL

      static final int KEEP_ALIVE_INTERVAL
      The interval (in milliseconds) between keep-alive messages sent to the peer to ensure the connection remains active. If no activity is detected during this period, a keep-alive message is sent.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TIMEOUT_THRESHOLD

      static final int TIMEOUT_THRESHOLD
      The threshold (in milliseconds) after which a connection is considered timed out if no activity or acknowledgment is received from the peer.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • HEARTBEAT_FAILURE_THRESHOLD

      static final int HEARTBEAT_FAILURE_THRESHOLD
      The maximum number of consecutive keep-alive message failures before the connection is considered lost and terminated.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values
